{/* Content */}
{/* Summary text */}

Anticipating the Red Mirage

As a data scientist at Hawkfish in 2020, my team polled Americans on their voting method preferences for the general election.

A record number of voters intended to mail in or drop off their ballots to avoid the risk of coronavirus exposure at the polls. However, many Trump supporters still planned to vote in person.

Because in-person ballots were counted and reported first in most states, my team anticipated the Red Mirage on election night.

We worked to innoculate the public against vote-by-mail disinformation and preempt Trump's false victory declaration.

On election night, Trump led in swing states where in-person ballots were counted and reported first. Four days later, after states had tallied mail-in ballots, Biden's victory was apparent.

{/* Analyzing our data */}

Measuring the Partisan Gap in Voting Method Selection

Which voting method will you use to cast your ballot in the general election?
